title: blockr.io Showcase: File I/O Blocks
text: blockr.io provides unified file /O blocks reading writing data blockr pipelines. read block handles loading data multiple sources formats smart, adaptive interface. write block enables exporting data various file formats, support browser downloads filesystem output. Together, blocks make easy build complete data workflows input output.

title: blockr.io Showcase: File I/O Blocks
text: read block versatile data loading block automatically adapts interface based file type ’re working . combines three different file source modes (upload, browse, URL) format-specific options CSV, Excel, file types.

title: blockr.io Showcase: File I/O Blocks
text: Upload Mode: Drag drop files click browse computer. Uploaded files stored persistently, remain available across sessions. perfect interactive data analysis want upload dataset keep working . Browse Mode: Navigate file system using interactive file browser. Select files configured folder paths. block reads directly original file location without copying. URL Mode: Download data directly web URL. Simply paste URL pointing CSV, Excel, supported file format. data downloaded fresh session starts.

title: blockr.io Showcase: File I/O Blocks
text: block detects file type shows relevant options: CSV/TSV files display options delimiter (comma, semicolon, tab), quote character, encoding, row skipping, whether first row contains column names. gives full control delimited text files parsed. Excel files show dropdown menus sheet selection, cell range specification (like “A1:C100”), row skipping, column name options. can target specific sheets ranges within Excel workbooks. formats (Parquet, Feather, SPSS, Stata, SAS, JSON, XML, etc.) handled automatically minimal configuration. block uses appropriate reader based file extension.

title: blockr.io Showcase: File I/O Blocks
text: select multiple files, block provides combination strategies: Auto: Automatically stacks files vertically columns, otherwise uses just first file Row bind: Stack files vertically (requires files columns) Column bind: Place files side--side (requires files number rows) First : Use first file, ignore others makes easy load combine related datasets one step. Read block interface showing CSV options

title: blockr.io Showcase: File I/O Blocks
text: block supports wide range file formats: Text formats: CSV, TSV, TXT, fixed-width files Spreadsheets: Excel (.xlsx, .xls), OpenDocument Spreadsheet (.ods) Statistical software: SPSS (.sav), Stata (.dta), SAS (.sas7bdat, .xpt) Columnar formats: Parquet, Feather, Arrow IPC Web formats: JSON, XML, HTML R formats: RDS, RData Database formats: DBF, SQLite

title: blockr.io Showcase: File I/O Blocks
text: write block versatile data export block accepts one dataframe inputs outputs files various formats. provides flexible options file naming, output location, format-specific parameters.

title: blockr.io Showcase: File I/O Blocks
text: Download Mode: block triggers browser download, saving file downloads folder. recommended mode beginners exporting analysis results. Files generated -demand click download button. Browse Mode: Write files directly server filesystem. Use directory browser select files saved. Files written immediately upstream data changes, making ideal automated pipelines.

title: blockr.io Showcase: File I/O Blocks
text: Fixed filename: Specify filename (without extension) create reproducible output. block always writes path, overwriting file upstream data changes. Perfect automated workflows want consistent file paths. Auto-timestamped: Leave filename empty generate unique timestamped files (e.g., data_20250127_143022.csv). preserves history prevents accidental overwrites, making safe default behavior.

title: blockr.io Showcase: File I/O Blocks
text: write block accepts multiple dataframe inputs, similar might combine datasets. output format depends file type: Excel format: Multiple inputs become sheets single Excel workbook. Sheet names derived input names (e.g., “sales_data”, “inventory”). CSV/Arrow formats: Multiple inputs bundled ZIP archive. dataframe saved separate file using input names. Single input: Outputs single file specified format.

title: blockr.io Showcase: File I/O Blocks
text: CSV: Comma-separated values configurable delimiter, quotes, NA handling Excel: .xlsx workbooks support multiple sheets Parquet: Efficient columnar storage format Feather: Fast binary format data frames Format-specific options (like CSV delimiter quote character) can configured args parameter. Write block interface showing download mode

title: blockr.io Showcase: File I/O Blocks
text: read write blocks work seamlessly blockr blocks create end--end data workflows. Load data read block, transform processing blocks, visualize results, export write block - without writing code. example, build pipeline : 1. Loads sales data CSV file (read block) 2. Filters show high-revenue transactions (filter block) 3. Aggregates product category (summarize block) 4. Creates visualization (plot block) 5. Exports processed data Excel (write block) Just connect blocks together create powerful, reproducible data workflows!

title: Authors and Citation
text: Christoph Sax. Author, maintainer. Nicolas Bennett. Author. David Granjon. Author. Mike Page. Author. Bristol Myers Squibb. Funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Sax C, Bennett N, Granjon D, Page M (2025). blockr.io: Interactive File Import Export Blocks. R package version 0.1.0, https://bristolmyerssquibb.github.io/blockr.io/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {blockr.io: Interactive File Import and Export Blocks},   author = {Christoph Sax and Nicolas Bennett and David Granjon and Mike Page},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://bristolmyerssquibb.github.io/blockr.io/}, }

what: Interactive File Import and Export Blocks
title: Interactive File Import and Export Blocks
text: blockr.io provides file /O blocks reading writing data various formats. Load CSV, Excel, Parquet, visual interfaces - code required.

title: Interactive File Import and Export Blocks
text: install development version GitHub:

title: Interactive File Import and Export Blocks
text: opens visual interface browser. Add blocks using “+” button connect build data pipelines.

title: Interactive File Import and Export Blocks
text: Load data multiple sources automatic format detection: Browser: Upload files via drag--drop (persisted across sessions) Server: Browse file system directly URL: Download data web URLs Supports CSV, Excel, Parquet, Feather, JSON, SPSS, Stata, SAS, .

title: Interactive File Import and Export Blocks
text: Export data various formats two output modes: Browser: Download files directly (recommended users) Server: Write file system (automated pipelines) Supports CSV, Excel, Parquet, Feather. Multiple inputs become Excel sheets ZIP archives.

title: Interactive File Import and Export Blocks
text: See vignette("blockr-io-showcase") screenshots detailed examples. blockr.io website includes full documentation. workflow engine, see blockr.core.

what: blockr.io: Interactive File Import and Export Blocks — blockr.io-package
title: blockr.io: Interactive File Import and Export Blocks — blockr.io-package
text: Adds blocks reading writing various data file types.

title: blockr.io: Interactive File Import and Export Blocks — blockr.io-package
text: Maintainer: Christoph Sax christoph@cynkra.com (ORCID) Authors: Nicolas Bennett nicolas@cynkra.com

title: Get blockr option with fallback — blockr_option

what: CSS Utilities for blockr.io Blocks — css-utilities
title: CSS Utilities for blockr.io Blocks — css-utilities
text: file provides centralized CSS functions consistent block styling. custom classes use .block- prefix distinguish framework classes (Bootstrap, Shiny, etc.) prevent naming conflicts.

title: CSS Utilities for blockr.io Blocks — css-utilities
text: Required blocks: css_responsive_grid() - Base grid layout block styling (REQUIRED) Common optional utilities: css_single_column() - Force single-column layout (common) css_advanced_toggle() - Collapsible sections toggle (optional) css_inline_checkbox() - Checkbox/label styling inline layouts (optional) Usage block UI:   Block-specific styling (unique one block) use tags$style(HTML(...)) directly block file, added . add CSS reused 2+ blocks.
code: ui = function(id) {   tagList(     css_responsive_grid(),        # Always include first     css_single_column("myblock"), # If single column layout needed     css_inline_checkbox(),        # If using inline checkboxes     # ... block-specific CSS with tags$style(HTML(...)) ...     # ... block HTML structure ...   ) }

what: Detect file category for UI adaptation — detect_file_category
title: Detect file category for UI adaptation — detect_file_category
text: Categorizes files extension broad categories determine UI options show (csv/excel/arrow/).

title: Detect file category for UI adaptation — detect_file_category
Detect file category for UI adaptation — detect_file_category

title: Detect file category for UI adaptation — detect_file_category

what: Generate filename for write operations — generate_filename
title: Generate filename for write operations — generate_filename
text: Generate filename write operations

title: Generate filename for write operations — generate_filename
Generate filename for write operations — generate_filename
text: filename Character. User-specified filename (without extension). empty NULL, generates timestamped filename. timestamp POSIXct timestamp auto-generated names. Default: Sys.time()

title: Generate filename for write operations — generate_filename
text: Character. Base filename without extension

Validate URL format — is_valid_url
text: Validate URL format

title: Validate URL format — is_valid_url
Unified file reading block — new_read_block
text: single block reading files various formats smart UI adapts based detected file type. Supports "Browser" (upload) "Server" (browse) modes persistent storage uploaded files.

title: Unified file reading block — new_read_block
code: new_read_block(   path = character(),   source = "upload",   combine = "auto",   args = list(),   ... )

title: Unified file reading block — new_read_block
text: path Character vector file paths pre-load. provided, automatically switches "path" mode regardless source parameter. source Either "upload" file upload widget, "path" file browser, "url" URL download. Default: "upload". Automatically set based path parameter. combine Strategy combining multiple files: "auto", "rbind", "cbind", "first" args Named list format-specific reading parameters. specify values differ defaults. Available parameters: CSV files: sep (default: ","), quote (default: '"'), encoding (default: "UTF-8"), skip (default: 0), n_max (default: Inf), col_names (default: TRUE) Excel files: sheet (default: NULL), range (default: NULL), skip (default: 0), n_max (default: Inf), col_names (default: TRUE) ... Forwarded blockr.core::new_data_block()

title: Unified file reading block — new_read_block
text: blockr data block reads file(s) returns data.frame.

title: Unified file reading block — new_read_block
text: block supports three modes: Browser mode (upload): User uploads files computer via browser Files copied persistent storage directory (upload_path) State stores permanent file paths Works across R sessions state restoration Server mode (path): User picks files already exist server file copying, reads directly original location State stores selected file paths running locally, computer's file system URL mode: User provides URL data file File downloaded temporary location time Always fetches fresh data URL State stores URL (file path)

title: Unified file reading block — new_read_block
text: file selection, UI detects file type shows relevant options: CSV/TSV: Delimiter, quote character, encoding options Excel: Sheet selection, cell range formats: Minimal options (handled automatically)

title: Unified file reading block — new_read_block
text: multiple files selected: "auto": Attempts rbind, falls back first file incompatible "rbind": Row-binds files (requires columns) "cbind": Column-binds files (requires row count) "first": Uses first file

title: Unified file reading block — new_read_block
text: following settings retrieved options stored block state: volumes: File browser mount points. Set via options(blockr.volumes = c(name = "path")) environment variable BLOCKR_VOLUMES. Default: c(home = "~") upload_path: Directory persistent file storage. Set via options(blockr.upload_path = "/path") environment variable BLOCKR_UPLOAD_PATH. Default: rappdirs::user_data_dir("blockr")

title: Unified file reading block — new_read_block
code: # Create a read block for a CSV file csv_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".csv") write.csv(mtcars[1:5, ], csv_file, row.names = FALSE) block <- new_read_block(path = csv_file) block #> <read_block<data_block<block>>> #> Name: "Read" #> No data inputs #> Initial block state: #>  $ path   : chr "/tmp/RtmpEqxPdk/file19286c715e5c.csv" #>  $ source : chr "upload" #>  $ combine: chr "auto" #>  $ args   : list() #> Constructor: blockr.io::new_read_block()  # With custom CSV parameters block <- new_read_block(   path = csv_file,   args = list(n_max = 3) )  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Launch interactive app serve(new_read_block()) } # }

title: Set names helper (base R doesn't export this in older versions) — set_names
Unified file writing block — new_write_block
text: variadic block writing dataframes files various formats. Accepts multiple input dataframes handles single files, multi-sheet Excel, ZIP archives depending format number inputs.

title: Unified file writing block — new_write_block
code: new_write_block(   directory = "",   filename = "",   format = "csv",   mode = "download",   auto_write = FALSE,   args = list(),   ... )

title: Unified file writing block — new_write_block
text: directory Character. Default directory file output (browse mode ). Can configured via options(blockr.write_dir = "/path") environment variable BLOCKR_WRITE_DIR. Default: current working directory. filename Character. Optional fixed filename (without extension). provided: Writes file path every upstream change (auto-overwrite) empty (default): Generates timestamped filename (e.g., data_20250127_143022.csv) format Character. Output format: "csv", "excel", "parquet", "feather". Default: "csv" mode Character. Either "download" "Browser" (triggers browser download), "browse" "Server" (writes server filesystem). Default: "download" auto_write Logical. TRUE, automatically writes files data changes (browse mode ). FALSE (default), user must click "Submit" button save. effect download mode. args Named list format-specific writing parameters. specify values differ defaults. Available parameters: CSV files: sep (default: ","), quote (default: TRUE), na (default: "") Excel/Arrow: Minimal options needed (handled underlying packages) ... Forwarded blockr.core::new_transform_block()

title: Unified file writing block — new_write_block
text: blockr transform block writes dataframes files

title: Unified file writing block — new_write_block
text: block accepts multiple dataframe inputs (1 ) similar bind_rows_block. Inputs can numbered ("1", "2", "3") named ("sales_data", "inventory"). Input names used sheet names (Excel) filenames (multi-file ZIP).

title: Unified file writing block — new_write_block
text: Single input: Writes single file specified format Filename: {filename}.{ext} data_{timestamp}.{ext} Multiple inputs + Excel: Single Excel file multiple sheets Sheet names derived input names Multiple inputs + CSV/Arrow: Single ZIP file containing individual files file named input names

title: Unified file writing block — new_write_block
text: Fixed filename (filename = "output"): Reproducible path: always writes {directory}/output.{ext} Overwrites file every upstream data change Ideal automated pipelines Auto-timestamped (filename = ""): Unique files: {directory}/data_YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS.{ext} Preserves history, prevents accidental overwrites Safe default behavior

what: Mode: To Browser vs To Server
title: Unified file writing block — new_write_block
text: Browser mode (download): Exports files computer Triggers download browser's download folder Useful exporting results Server mode (browse): Saves files directly server User selects directory file browser Files persist server running locally, computer's file system

title: Unified file writing block — new_write_block
code: # Create a write block for CSV output block <- new_write_block(   directory = tempdir(),   filename = "output",   format = "csv" ) block #> <write_block<rbind_block<transform_block<block>>>> #> Name: "Write" #> Indefinite arity #> Initial block state: #>  $ directory : chr "/tmp/RtmpEqxPdk" #>  $ filename  : chr "output" #>  $ format    : chr "csv" #>  $ mode      : chr "download" #>  $ auto_write: logi FALSE #>  $ args      : list() #> Constructor: blockr.io::new_write_block()  # Write block for Excel with auto-timestamp block <- new_write_block(   directory = tempdir(),   filename = "",   format = "excel" )  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Launch interactive app serve(new_write_block()) } # }

title: blockr.io 0.0.1
text: Initial CRAN release.

title: blockr.io 0.0.1
text: CSV, TSV, delimited files (via readr) Excel files (via readxl) Arrow formats: Parquet, Feather, IPC (via arrow) formats via rio package URL support remote files Multi-file selection combine options (rbind, cbind) Advanced CSV options (delimiter, encoding, skip rows, etc.)

title: blockr.io 0.0.1
text: CSV export (via readr) Excel export multiple sheets (via writexl) Parquet Feather export (via arrow) Directory browser output location Auto-timestamped filenames Multiple dataset export (zipped CSV/Arrow)

title: blockr.io 0.0.1
text: Full documentation exported functions Package website examples
